post_title: Where to find stepik review quizzes?
description: Where do we find the weekly review quizzes on stepik? I tried looking for this week's and could not find it, is it just not posted yet?

history.description:
Near the top of the lecture pages:
- Lecture 2 - https://ucsd-cse8a-sp24.github.io/lectures/lecture2.html
- Lecture 3 - https://ucsd-cse8a-sp24.github.io/lectures/lecture3.html

Is that the orange link? But that lead to textbook with problems 

(At the end of each week, there will be a Stepik Exercises, which will be due at 8:00 AM PT (Pacific Time) on Saturdays.)

In the syllabus, its says that there will be a Stepik Exercises. How we find that?

(There will be 10 RQs in total and you can attempt the Stepik exercises multiple times until you get them correct!)

There are no 10 RQs, or "RQs" means those questions at the end of each section? 

Please help, Thank You!

follow_up.description:
As listed in the syllabus, "Stepik Exercises (i.e. Review Quizzes/RQs): 20%"

So please be sure to complete all the questions in the assigned Stepik readings to receive credit for the Stepik Exercises portion of the grade.

description: I am trying to complete the assignments on Stepik however my code is being read incorrectly. I tried the same program on IDLE and got the correct output but when I copy paste that code onto Stepik it is telling me that my program is incorrect. I tried to type it out the same way I did on IDLE to get that output but It didn't work.

history.description: Hi there! I would recommend resetting the problem and rewriting in the code from scratch. If you are still experiencing this issue, please feel free to make a private piazza post to the instructors only including a screenshot of this issue for further assistance. Thanks!

description: When doing the second last practice question on Stepic topic 1.7, the code and output in the question is correct when I run my code. However the website says my output is wrong (37) when it is clearly correct (30). A similar code in the next question did not yield any errors. How could I fix this issue? Thank you!

history.description: In the intro for this problem, it is explained that "Your manager is using an old system where the number of hours you input is always rounded down to the nearest hour." The practice problem requires that you take that rounding down into account.

You can find the lecture pages from the schedule. The lecture pages also have the required pre-lecture videos.

description: what is the late policy for the Stepik exercises?

history.description:
As per the syllabus, 

The online texbook records your progress, and we give a schedule of expected times to finish the readings. There is no penalty for completing these late, but all Stepik exercises must be completed by Saturday of Week 10 by 8am. After this time, no late submissions will be accepted, for any reason.
To ensure you get credit for the Stepik exercises, you must fill out this form by Friday of Week 2. Starting in Week 3, we will strive to post Stepik grade updates to Canvas every week.

description: I'm not sure what I did wrong but I tried various different ways and cannot get it correct.

history.description:
Hey,
Think about how you can compare the lengths of two strings. Whichever length is longer, that length should be stored in your longer_length variable.

Hint: Take a look at the max() function. To help you recall it, watch this pre-lecture video for Lecture 2 which shows you how to use it.

description: I have written the following code and tested it on idle to ensure that I get the right output. I'm not sure what this error is or how to fix it but I am positive that the code is correct. Please let me know how to fix this.

history.description:
Hey,
You should assume that s1, s2 and s3 are already given to you. Don't worry about using the input() function to get these variables, that's being done internally. You can just keep line 5 of your code and it should pass the test.

Hint: Try using the button "Run code" to see how the output of the code you've written looks like. Examine the output, then reiterate and keep modifying your code until it matches the expected output given in the problem.

description: Hi, I saw in another post that another student seemed to have the same problem and the reply was to make a private post with a screenshot. When I run my code in IDLE it works as it should but when I run it through Stepik it doesn't work. I made sure to type it directly into Stepik and not copy and paste from IDLE as well as reset/reload the problem multiple times.

history.description:
Referencing the problem instructions:
"Write a function called is_less_than_10 that takes an integer and returns a boolean value, True if the integer is less than 10, otherwise False (see the sample inputs for some examples)."

In this implementation, is_less_than_10 is a boolean variable, rather than a function. A function definition would include a function header def is_less_than_10():, as well as the specified parameter, return type, and the other necessary code in the body of the function.

description: Hi guys, is anyone else receiving a 502 error message when logging into Stepik? I’ve restarted my computer and closed/reopened tabs etc. Let me know if this is happening for anyone! Thank you

history.description: Never mind I got it!

description: Hi instructors, I keep having this <function joined_with_commas at 0x7fdc203d2e18> message under my output and I have no idea where's that from.

history.description:
The instructions say:
"Define a variable called joined_with_commas that holds a string with the contents of s1, followed by a comma, followed by s2, followed by a comma, followed by s3."

Your implementation here defines joined_with_comma as a function, rather than a variable, hence the error message. In cases like this, where you can see that your code does the string joining part correctly but the answer is marked as incorrect, be sure to review the instructions carefully!

description:
Hello,
My stepik has been extremely glitchy since I first started using it. It fails to save my points for all of the assignments that I have completed and will give me a green sign for correct answers but not say that I have been awarded points for the section. It also doesn't let me edit my code correctly because every time I type a new character into the file, the characters all move around. I can't click on a specific section with my cursor to edit: I have to delete the entire line to fix a typo, etc. Also, it currently is not letting me submit/run code at all. The site responds and lets me access all the content but not submit at all.
Has this been happening to anyone else? I cannot figure out why this website won't work for me.

history.description: Hello,I have noted a few complaints from students regarding Stepik.  One solution that has resolved many "glitches" is to whitelist Stepik if you are using any adblocker software.  Another solution is to clear your browser cache and restart your browser.  it has been noted that Stepik works best with Google Chrome.   Additionally, there have been comments that after long periods of inactivity, stepik will become unresponsive so it is best to close the stepik tab and re-open it if you notice that.I hope this helps, if you have continued issues please try and provide screenshots if they can show the issue.

description:
Hello,

Earlier this evening I made a post about my stepik not working. It was a new development tonight on my computer that I was not able to submit anything (submit and run code buttons were not responding). However, these functions previously had been working and after refreshing a few times I was able to finish every assignment and have it say all green and full points received. Tonight, I completed the assignment on my iPad and it worked fully. However, when looking back through the previous assignments on my stepik, it did not have full green for ANY of them, even though I have done every single one. 
I am very worried about the possibility of none of this data having been saved due to this glitch and I was hoping there was some way you would be able to tell me whether it indicates for you all that I have completed the assignments and gotten credit. Otherwise, I do not know how I am supposed to ensure that this site functions fully and I am getting credit for doing all of these assignments. Thank you so much.

Best,
Lucy Catalano

history.description:

I haven't heard of issues like that happening before.

Starting this week, we will be posting status updates. This will show you your current grade as well as giving you a snapshot of each chapter's completion percent.

description: I keep getting this error in Stepik and I don’t know how to get around it? Please help!

history.description:
It seems like you might be returning the triangle_area function itself as an additional part of your output; make sure you're only printing/returning the output variable.
If this hint does not help, please provide more detailed information about your code, because it's difficult to determine the exact issue from this screenshot alone;
I keep getting this error on different stepik problems, but on other ones it is fine? I have tried taking out various pieces of the code and cannot figure out how to get it to go away. Please help!

follow_up.description: It's hard to say what the issue is from the code alone. Please come to office hours on autograder if you still need help.

description:
My code keeps outputting twice but I don't know why and how to make it only output once. It has happened on almost all of my Stepik ones.
Can someone help plsScreenshot_2024-05-02_at_6.32.00_PM.png

history.description:
Read the question carefully - "Your task is to write a variable declaration for a variable called smaller that holds the minimum of x and y"
That's all you have to do... Nothing else...
Just write the variable declaration. There is no need to print it.
There is also no need to populate the values of x and y. Stepik will do that for you when it runs your code.

description:
Hello everyone.
I have been struggling with this one stepik exercise and wondered if anyone could give me a hand or a hint. My assumption was that Test1, Test3, and Test5 were correct. My confusion surrounds the returns at the end.
Thank you!

history.description: Only tests 1 and 3 are correct, so you should choose 2, 4, and 5.  These are wrong because if you look back at the text, they are supposed to return [1,4 ], [1, 4], and [1], but when you run the tests, they won't return these.  I'm not really sure why.

The reason why 2,4,5 failed is because after the function finished returns, it stopped. Thereby, if the function finds the name in the list, it returns the [idx], then the whole function stops, and we only get [idx] for our output. Hope this helps.

description: Is there a way to get help on stepik exercises? I am struggling to complete them.

history.description:
Tutor hours are a great resource to get help on Stepik. Please check out https://autograder.ucsd.edu/queue/738 to see our hours. 

In addition, you are more than welcome to make a post here on Piazza with any issues you are struggling with on Stepik. If you include code in your post, please make the post private.

description: I am a bit confused about what this question is asking and am unsure on how to proceed with my code. Could I get a breakdown of what is supposed to happen with the wanted coded? Thank you!

history.description:
For this problem, all you need to do is to return an explicit 2D list representation of the 3x3 image.

i.e. explicitly return a 2D list in this format (of course filling in the blanks)
[[(255,0,0), (...), (...)], [...], [...]]

description: Could I get more assistance with this problem, how to interpret it and how to proceed with my code?

history.description: For this part, you don't need to define a function as part of your answer. Your logic is correct, simply do it outside of a function!

description:

I have been attempting to figure out what the difference is between my output answer and the desired output that the Stepik wants. While I understand that my code is a bit messy, I don't understand why my outcome would not pass through. 

Thank you in advance!

history.description:
I'm pretty sure that the test cases aren't always going to be testing for 3 days. In other words, the number of rows in your output will depend on the length of predicted_growths, which is not always going to be 3.

Hope this helps. Please follow-up if you have any more questions
It helped a lot I was able to figure it out. Thank you!

history.description: Thank you! Thanks!

follow_up.description:
We can only apply a single Stepik ID to a student.

There is no way for us to get the scores from Chapters 1 and 2 while using the new Stepik ID.

description: For this question, since rgb_square has the same reference as both image and copy_image, why image and copy_image doesn't have the same reference. Also, is id and reference the same thing? Thanks for answering!

history.description:
To answer this question, we'll look mostly at the function call rgb_square = make_copy(rgb_square)
rgb_square and img contain references to the same object due to this part of the function call: make_copy(rgb_square). The object that rgb_square points to (the 2D list of tuples) is what is passed in as a parameter to the make_copy function, where it is now also represented by the local variable img, upon being pased in.
And copy_img contains a reference to the same object as rgb_square in the rgb_square = part of the function call. Here, the object outputted by make_copy (which is copy_img, as it is returned by the function) is newly assigned to the rgb_square variable.
img and copy_img do not refer to the same object at any point; img first refers to the same object as rgb_square, then rgb_square is reassigned to contain a reference to the same object as copy_img.

And, to answer your second question, the two are indeed closely related. A reference is a name that refers to the specific location in memory of a value (object); id() produces the numerical value that is the memory address for the object (generally supposed to be unique for an object during its lifetime).
